## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.PageIndexChanged> event is raised when a button in the page selection element of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control is clicked.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPageChangedEventArgs>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPageChangedEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).

## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPageChangedEventArgs.CommandSource%2A> property to determine the source of the command that raised the event. Because this event is raised only when a button in the page selection element of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control is clicked, the returned source is a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> object that represents the page selection element.

## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPageChangedEventArgs.NewPageIndex%2A> property to determine the index of the page selected by the user in the page selection element of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control. This value is often used to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.CurrentPageIndex%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control to display the selected page.
